sentences.en: " A two - year - old and we'll break " it on the strand.
sentences.cn: “ 买一匹两 岁 的,咱们牵到海滩上驯去.

sentences.en: A binder is necessary for strand integrity.
sentences.cn: 粘结剂对纤维的集束性能是必需的.

sentences.en: A sizing is applied to the filaments just before they are gathered into a strand.
sentences.cn: 在这些单丝快要集束成一股之前,在单丝上加上浸润剂.

sentences.en: A strand of her hair swept Gerty's cheek with its fragrance.
sentences.cn: 她的一缕芳香的头发掠过葛泰的面颊.

sentences.en: Because each strand is so fine, spider silk seems very weak.
sentences.cn: 因为每一根丝都非常纤细, 蛛丝似乎十分柔弱.

sentences.en: Changes in strand tension can be easily determined if the bridge deck is resurfaced.
sentences.cn: 当桥面重新铺装时,易于确定钢索内拉力的变化情况.

sentences.en: Each strand is fabricated of parallel wires bunched in a hexagonal shape.
sentences.cn: 每根钢束由平行钢丝捆扎成六边形.

sentences.en: Indeed, this strand may well predate the anti - pollution effort.
sentences.cn: 而且, 这一目标或许要早于防止污染.

sentences.en: Not a strand of her golden hair was out of place.
One strand of silk doesn't make a thread; one tree doesn't make a forest.
sentences.cn: 单丝不成线, 独木不成林.

sentences.en: Sarah lifted her hand and started twirling a strand of hair.
sentences.cn: 萨拉抬起手来开始用手指缠绕一缕头发。

sentences.en: She tried to blow a gray strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她竭力想把眼前的一缕白发吹开。

sentences.en: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.en: She tucked a loose strand of hair behind her ears.
sentences.cn: 她把一缕散发夹到了耳后.

sentences.en: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.cn: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

sentences.en: The Strand is one of London's busiest and most affluent streets.
sentences.cn: 斯特兰德街是伦敦最繁华、最富足的街道之一。

words.tran_cn: 搁浅的；陷于困境的；有…股的（常用来构成复合词）
搁浅（strand的过去式和过去分词）
使搁浅；使陷于困境；弄断；使落后

phrases.tran_cn: 多股绞合线；钢丝绳股；绞合线；绳索

trans.tran_cn: （绳子的）股，绞，海滨，河岸，（思想等的）一个组成部分
trans.tran_en: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc

trans.tran_cn: 使搁浅；使陷于困境；弄断；使落后
trans.tran_en: to leave or drive (ships, fish, etc) aground or ashore or (of ships, fish, etc) to be left or driven ashore

trans.tran_cn: 使滞留，使搁浅，使陷于困境
trans.tran_en: to leave or drive (ships, fish, etc) aground or ashore or (of ships, fish, etc) to be left or driven ashore
